episodes.title: Powerless in the Face of Death
episodes.plot: Life goes on after the tragic deaths of Hank and Dean. Meanwhile, the Monarch deals with life "inside," but you can't keep a good criminal mastermind down. Will King Gorilla prove to be his greatest ally or his worst betrayer?

episodes.title: Hate Floats
episodes.plot: The Monarch has escaped from prison, and the Henchmen re-assemble to serve him. Dr. Venture takes Dean to a shopping mall and the family gets ambushed by the Monarch who was there attempting to win back Dr. Girlfriend.

episodes.title: Assassinanny 911
episodes.plot: Molotov Cocktease fills in at the Venture compound as Brock goes on a mission to terminate a rogue agent. While Molotov tries to beat some masculinity into Dr. Venture and his sons, we learn something of Brock's past through flashbacks.

episodes.title: Escape to the House of Mummies Part II
episodes.plot: Team Venture find themselves trapped in the clutches of a bloodthirsty Egyptian cult and their time machine. Dr. Venture narrowly escapes and teams up with Master Billy Quizboy and Pete White, but promptly forgets to mount a rescue. So it's up to Brock and a pantheon of history's greatest men to find another way out.

episodes.title: Twenty Years to Midnight
episodes.plot: While a mysterious extra-terrestrial Inquisitor evaluates human culture, Dr. Venture discovers an old video recording from his father informing him he must, before tomorrow night, locate and assemble the hidden pieces to a device that will save the Earth from certain doom.

episodes.title: Victor. Echo. November.
episodes.plot: Hilarity ensues when the Phantom Limb and Dr. Girlfriend try to patch up their differences with the Monarch by going on a double-date with him and his Internet date.

episodes.title: Love-Bheits
episodes.plot: Baron Underbheit returns as the Venture Bros jet crashes in Underland. The Baron seeks revenge on Dr. Venture and attempts to marry Dean, who is dressed in a Princess Leia slave girl costume when they are captured.

episodes.title: Fallen Arches
episodes.plot: Dr. Orpheus is awarded an official "Guild of Calamitous Intent" arch villain. He assembles his team of three and auditions his prospective villain at the Venture compound.

episodes.title: Guess Who's Coming to State Dinner?
episodes.plot: Gargantuan 1 crashes and Col. Bud Manstrong survives and hailed as a national hero. He and the Ventures are then honored at the White House. But the ghost of Abraham Lincoln appears suspecting an attempt will be made to assassinate the President.

episodes.title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Kills
episodes.plot: The boys are kidnapped by a woman claiming to be their mother. Dr. Orpheus helps Dr. Venture get rid of a Japanese demon that is tied to him.

episodes.title: ¡Viva los muertos!
episodes.plot: While Dr. Venture constructs his Venturestien Monster, Brock has an existential crisis and a parody "Scooby Gang" arrives, looking to solve a "Mystery". Hilarity, violence, tripping on some vine juice, and a general pissing on Scooby Doo.

episodes.title: Showdown at Cremation Creek: Part 1
episodes.plot: The Monarch proposes to Dr. Girlfriend. Thanks to the hasty actions of the Henchmen, the entire Venture family finds themselves participating in the wedding. Phantom Limb crashes the party, threatening to destroy everyone unless the wedding is called off.

episodes.title: Showdown at Cremation Creek: Part 2
episodes.plot: The second part of the season finale. Battle begins between Phantom Limb and the Monarch wedding party. Brock takes charge of the Henchmen in an effort to rescue Dr. Girlfriend.
